Name: Amateru
Meaning: From Amaterasu, the Japanese goddess of the sun

Name: Arkas
Meaning: One of the sons of Zeus and Callisto in Greek mythology

Name: Dulcinea
Meaning: from the word for “sweet” in Spanish

Name: Jupiter
Meaning: Roman equivalent to the Greek god Zeus

Name: Mars
Meaning: Roman equivalent of the Greek god Ares

Name: Mercury
Meaning: Roman equivalent of the Greek god Hermes

Name: Meztli
Meaning: Aztec god of the moon and the night

Name: Neptune
Meaning: Roman equivalent of the Greek god Poseidon

Name: Saturn
Meaning: Roman equivalent to the Greek god Cronus

Name: Taphao Kaew
Meaning: One of two sisters associated with a Thai folk tale

Name: Taphao Thong
Meaning: One of two sisters associated with a Thai folk tale

Name: Uranus
Meaning: Personification of the sky in Greek mythology

Name: Venus
Meaning: Roman equivalent of the Greek goddess Aphrodite

Name: Orcus
Meaning: One of the Roman deities of the underworld

Name: Salacia
Meaning: Roman goddess of salt water. Consort to Neptune.

Name: Haumea
Meaning: Goddess of fertility and childbirth in Hawaiian mythology

Name: Quaoar
Meaning: Mythological figure of the Mission Indians of coastal Southern California

Name: Eris
Meaning: Gree goddess of strife and discord

Name: Sedna
Meaning: Goddess of the sea in Inuit mythology

Name: Varda
Meaning: Queen of the Valar, creator of the stars in J.R.R. Tolkien’s books
